content: This gives substance to one Democratic congressman's call to seal the border with Mexico ... and causes one to wonder why Napolitano and Obama seem to think it is no big deal. quote: MEXICO CITY (AP) - Two weeks after the first known swine flu death, Mexico still hasn't given medicine to the families of the dead. It hasn't determined where the outbreak began or how it spread. And while the government urges anyone who feels sick to go to hospitals, feverish people complain ambulance workers are scared to pick them up. A portrait is emerging of a slow and confused response by Mexico to the gathering swine flu epidemic. And that could mean the world is flying blind into a global health storm. Despite an annual budget of more than $5 billion, Mexico's health secretary said Monday that his agency hasn't had the resources to visit the families of the dead. That means doctors haven't begun treatment for the population most exposed to swine flu, and most apt to spread it. It also means medical sleuths don't know how the victims were infected—key to understanding how the epidemic began and how it can be contained. <more> "http://www.breitbart.com/article.php?id=D97R5N5O0&show_article=1" This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds.
quote: MEXICO CITY (AP) - Two weeks after the first known swine flu death, Mexico still hasn't given medicine to the families of the dead. It hasn't determined where the outbreak began or how it spread. And while the government urges anyone who feels sick to go to hospitals, feverish people complain ambulance workers are scared to pick them up. A portrait is emerging of a slow and confused response by Mexico to the gathering swine flu epidemic. And that could mean the world is flying blind into a global health storm. Despite an annual budget of more than $5 billion, Mexico's health secretary said Monday that his agency hasn't had the resources to visit the families of the dead. That means doctors haven't begun treatment for the population most exposed to swine flu, and most apt to spread it. It also means medical sleuths don't know how the victims were infected—key to understanding how the epidemic began and how it can be contained. <more> "http://www.breitbart.com/article.php?id=D97R5N5O0&show_article=1"
reply: This gives substance to one Democratic congressman's call to seal the border with Mexico ... and causes one to wonder why Napolitano and Obama seem to think it is no big deal.  This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds.
title: Mexico's Inept Response to Swine Flu Outbreak ...

content: Mexico has done an outstanding job so far. They informed everybody that there was a problem in a timely fashion. They have cooperated with CDC's in other countries to assist with pinpointing the source of the problem. (Which is starting to look like a very large hog operation run by a Virginia-based meat packing company in Mexico.) The problems in Mexico, ie the large number of deaths and infections can be laid at the door of a US style pay-as-you-go health system. Private health and public health can be two very different critters - considering that, Mexico has done very well. Further considering that he's jockeying a bronco around the economy, and commanding a fairly significant military operation or two in Asia, POTUS seems to have public health in the US fairly-well mobilized to deal with the flu. Private health care - will be there for those who can afford it, of course.

They don't even care. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: quote: Originally posted by I_M_Qwerty: LMAO ... so Mexico has done an outstanding job because they told everybody there was a problem. Tell that to the families of the the dead ... You never cease to amaze me. It figures you'd find a way to blame the U.S. Last I checked the number of confirmed cases in the US continues to climb...so what are we doing? How is any government responsible for a damn outbreak of influenza? These things happen in the past, today, and will again tomorrow....You cannot mess with nature at this level. This is a micro-organism, closing borders, and restricting flights AT THIS POINT is useless and will only cause economic harm. Had the virus only been isolated in Mexico then sure, everyone seize flights there, but that is just a stupid, political move at this time.

content: quote: Originally posted by mrmixitup: quote: Originally posted by I_M_Qwerty: This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds. Um, he's already declared a national health emergency and is letting the CDC do their job. Okay, I'll bite. What SHOULD he have done? Declare a war on microbes, and arm all Americans with these itty bitty machine guys that are radar controlled to knockoff the microscopic swine that are spreading around the world... ************* Apparently they're trying to isolate each of the mini-outbreaks as soon as they pop up. If tamiflu really is effective, then we should be distributing it to these same outbreaks. Reading up on that drug, it has powerful side effects. Difficult to say if it should be used prophalactically. The plain truth of the matter is that we don't really know what's happening. Not we the public and not the hot shot doctors. It's too new. Even my saying that tamiflu works is pre-mature. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: They certainly got the word out when compared to the way China sat on SARS. The first death occurred before the test results were back. Those results said 'swine flu'. It's only this week that tests have revealed this virus is a compendium, and this from a top-notch Canadian lab. You can 'laff your ass off' all you like, your newsys are still telling people it's only 'swine flu'. As far as the source, if you'll read what I wrote again, you'll realize I'm not blaming anybody. How do you stop pigs from getting sick, if you can't stop it happening to people? Now if somebody had sick pigs and didn't report it .... that's something else. So far the company has denied it was their stock, or that the pigs were sick at all. That remains to be tested. The stock market seems to be blaming two American companies - Smithfield (which owned that hog farm) and Tyson Foods shares took a hit on the markets. Apparently some folk think eating pork gives one the flu, when kissin' a pig might. Go drink your tamiflu and calm down. Actually a lot of people think you get it from pork because of the name. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds.
title: Mexico's Inept Response to Swine Flu Outbreak ...

content: Mexico has done an outstanding job so far. They informed everybody that there was a problem in a timely fashion. They have cooperated with CDC's in other countries to assist with pinpointing the source of the problem. (Which is starting to look like a very large hog operation run by a Virginia-based meat packing company in Mexico.) The problems in Mexico, ie the large number of deaths and infections can be laid at the door of a US style pay-as-you-go health system. Private health and public health can be two very different critters - considering that, Mexico has done very well. Further considering that he's jockeying a bronco around the economy, and commanding a fairly significant military operation or two in Asia, POTUS seems to have public health in the US fairly-well mobilized to deal with the flu. Private health care - will be there for those who can afford it, of course.

If you scroll over the circles you will see how many are confirmed and how many are suspected. Everyone has done this, but Mexico....it has a total of 1995 with Confirmed: N/A and Suspected: N/A. They don't even care. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

How is any government responsible for a damn outbreak of influenza? These things happen in the past, today, and will again tomorrow....You cannot mess with nature at this level. This is a micro-organism, closing borders, and restricting flights AT THIS POINT is useless and will only cause economic harm. Had the virus only been isolated in Mexico then sure, everyone seize flights there, but that is just a stupid, political move at this time.

content: quote: Originally posted by mrmixitup: quote: Originally posted by I_M_Qwerty: This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds. Um, he's already declared a national health emergency and is letting the CDC do their job. Okay, I'll bite. What SHOULD he have done? Declare a war on microbes, and arm all Americans with these itty bitty machine guys that are radar controlled to knockoff the microscopic swine that are spreading around the world... ************* Apparently they're trying to isolate each of the mini-outbreaks as soon as they pop up. If tamiflu really is effective, then we should be distributing it to these same outbreaks. Reading up on that drug, it has powerful side effects. Difficult to say if it should be used prophalactically. The plain truth of the matter is that we don't really know what's happening. Not we the public and not the hot shot doctors. It's too new. Even my saying that tamiflu works is pre-mature. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: They certainly got the word out when compared to the way China sat on SARS. The first death occurred before the test results were back. Those results said 'swine flu'. It's only this week that tests have revealed this virus is a compendium, and this from a top-notch Canadian lab. You can 'laff your ass off' all you like, your newsys are still telling people it's only 'swine flu'. As far as the source, if you'll read what I wrote again, you'll realize I'm not blaming anybody. How do you stop pigs from getting sick, if you can't stop it happening to people? Now if somebody had sick pigs and didn't report it .... that's something else. So far the company has denied it was their stock, or that the pigs were sick at all. That remains to be tested. The stock market seems to be blaming two American companies - Smithfield (which owned that hog farm) and Tyson Foods shares took a hit on the markets. Apparently some folk think eating pork gives one the flu, when kissin' a pig might. Go drink your tamiflu and calm down. Actually a lot of people think you get it from pork because of the name. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: quote: Originally posted by I_M_Qwerty: This gives substance to one Democratic congressman's call to seal the border with Mexico ... and causes one to wonder why Napolitano and Obama seem to think it is no big deal. quote: MEXICO CITY (AP) - Two weeks after the first known swine flu death, Mexico still hasn't given medicine to the families of the dead. It hasn't determined where the outbreak began or how it spread. And while the government urges anyone who feels sick to go to hospitals, feverish people complain ambulance workers are scared to pick them up. A portrait is emerging of a slow and confused response by Mexico to the gathering swine flu epidemic. And that could mean the world is flying blind into a global health storm. Despite an annual budget of more than $5 billion, Mexico's health secretary said Monday that his agency hasn't had the resources to visit the families of the dead. That means doctors haven't begun treatment for the population most exposed to swine flu, and most apt to spread it. It also means medical sleuths don't know how the victims were infected—key to understanding how the epidemic began and how it can be contained. <more> "http://www.breitbart.com/article.php?id=D97R5N5O0&show_article=1" This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds. Didn't you know it's the USA's fault...... /sarcasm off

That means doctors haven't begun treatment for the population most exposed to swine flu, and most apt to spread it. It also means medical sleuths don't know how the victims were infected—key to understanding how the epidemic began and how it can be contained. <more> "http://www.breitbart.com/article.php?id=D97R5N5O0&show_article=1" This is POTUS 44's first real major challenge ... and so far, his administration seems heavy on words, light on deeds.
